channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet five new species discovered in 2025
item.description: A bumpy snailfish, Andean mouse opossum and ancient sea cow were just some of the many species described in 2025.

item.title: His brother's mental illness isolated his family. Now he's helping other caregivers
item.description: When it comes to serious mental illness, family caregivers are crucial partners. But often, they must fend for themselves. A new solution offers them ...

item.title: Greetings from Vienna, where an imperial palace hosts a holiday market for all
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: What to know about Nick Shirley, the YouTuber alleging day care fraud in Minnesota
item.description: Shirley is a 23-year-old self-described "independent YouTube journalist" who made prank videos in high school before pivoting to politics. He particip...

item.title: Why flu cases are surging this season. And, protests erupt in Iran over the economy
item.description: The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's t...

item.title: Israel to bar 37 aid groups as UK and EU warn of severe impact in Gaza
item.description: Israel's move is criticised by 10 countries, which say the new registration rules for international NGOs are "restrictive" and "unacceptable".

item.title: Fireworks, drums and light shows: How the world is welcoming 2026
item.description: Countries around the world celebrated the new year with colourful shows and long-held traditions.

item.title: In pictures: New Year welcomed around the world
item.description: From spectacular firework displays to chilly sea dips, nations celebrate the start of 2026.

item.title: EU's top diplomat rejects Russian claims of Ukrainian attack on government sites
item.description: It comes as Russia releases video which it claims shows a downed Ukrainian drone launched at one of Putin's residences.

item.title: ACA enrollee says "we'll have to make some adjustments" amid expiring subsidies
item.description: Alix Flores, an Affordable Care Act Marketplace enrollee, joins CBS News 24/7 to explain how his health care will change in 2026 as subsidies are set ...

item.title: Department of Justice is reviewing more than 5.2 million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein
Day care in Minneapolis vandalized after viral video purporting fraud
item.description: A Minneapolis day care says that vandals damaged the facility early this week, after a YouTube video purporting to expose fraud among day cares in the...

item.title: 12/21: Sunday Morning
item.description: Hosted by Jane Pauley. Featured: the town that inspired "It's a Wonderful Life"; Sean Ono Lennon on his parents' legacy; the a capella group Pentatoni...

item.title: New Year's Eve celebrations kick off as 2026 arrives around the world
item.description: New Zealand and Australia were among the first to welcome 2026, but in Sydney and some other cities, the festivities are tinged by grief.

item.title: Finnish police seize ship suspected of sabotaging undersea cable
item.description: Police arrested 14 crew members on the ship sailing from St Petersburg, Russia, to the Israeli port of Haifa.

item.title: Sprinkles founder confirms cupcake chain is closing permanently
item.description: The chain started in Beverly Hills in 2005.

item.title: Midwest hit with more extreme cold after winter storm
